snippet: Jason Hanson, the Detroit Lions kicker, is retiring after 21 seasons. Hanson became the first player to play 300 games with one franchise, finishing with 327 games.
abstract: Detroit Lions kicker Jason Hanson, who became the first player to play 300 games with one franchise, finishing with 327 games, is retiring after 21 seasons; other NFL developments noted.
lead_paragraph: Jason Hanson, the Detroit Lions kicker, is retiring after 21 seasons. Hanson became the first player to play 300 games with one franchise, finishing with 327 games.

headline.seo: Lions’ Jason Hanson Retires After 21 Seasons
